intro: Ditaxis rhizantha, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that resemble small ghosts. The plant is known for its striking white petals and a distinctive, elongated shape. It thrives in arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
